natural problem: What is the residue of $9^{2010}$, modulo 17?
natural solution: We start by generating powers of 9 modulo 17. Note that we can generate $9^{2k}$ from $9^k$ by squaring $9^k$.

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b c :: nat
assumes h0 : "a = 9 ^ 2010"
and h1 : "b = 17"
and h2 : "c = a mod b"
shows  "c = 13"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 What is the residue of $9^{2010}$, modulo 17? The final Answer is 13
 ### Proof
 We start by generating powers of 9 modulo 17. Note that we can generate $9^{2k}$ from $9^k$ by squaring $9^k$.
 We get \begin{align} 9^1 &\equiv 9 \pmod{17} \\ 9^2 &\equiv 13 \pmod{17} \\ 9^4 &\equiv 16 \pmod{17} \\ 9^8 &\equiv 1 \pmod{17}. \end{align}Since $9^8 \equiv 1$ modulo 17, we have \begin{align} 9^{2010} &\equiv 9^2 9^{2008} \\
 &\equiv 9^2 (9^8)^{251} \\ &\equiv 9^2 1^{251} \\ &\equiv 9^2 \\ &\equiv \boxed{13} \pmod{17}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes a b c :: nat
assumes h0 : "a = 9 ^ 2010"
and h1 : "b = 17"
and h2 : "c = a mod b"
shows  "c = 13"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: What is the remainder when $9^{2010}$ is divided by $17$? The final answer is $13$.

a_1.formal problem:
theorem
fixes res :: nat
assumes h0 : "res = 9^2010 mod 17"
shows  "res = 13"
a_1.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 What is the residue of $9^{2010}$, modulo 17? The final Answer is 13
 ### Proof
 We start by generating powers of 9 modulo 17. Note that we can generate $9^{2k}$ from $9^k$ by squaring $9^k$.
 We get \begin{align} 9^1 &\equiv 9 \pmod{17} \\ 9^2 &\equiv 13 \pmod{17} \\ 9^4 &\equiv 16 \pmod{17} \\ 9^8 &\equiv 1 \pmod{17}. \end{align}Since $9^8 \equiv 1$ modulo 17, we have \begin{align} 9^{2010} &\equiv 9^2 9^{2008} \\
 &\equiv 9^2 (9^8)^{251} \\ &\equiv 9^2 1^{251} \\ &\equiv 9^2 \\ &\equiv \boxed{13} \pmod{17}. \end{align}
 *)

theorem
fixes res :: nat
assumes h0 : "res = 9^2010 mod 17"
shows  "res = 13"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_1.informal problem: What is the remainder when $9^{2010}$ is divided by 17? The answer is 13.
